title: Common Framework for ICT in Transport Logistics: What are the next steps to be taken?
segmentation: So good morning, I try to be fast.
I have only six slides so and they were meant to still discussion 'cause they try to be provocative.
And so you will discuss a lot during lunch I imagine.
I will.

Well, I've been given the task of speaking about the next steps that I like very much, because for once in this conference, I'm not going to do the usual project speech to show how good we are in the good results.
We produced my interpretation about the next steps is to look somewhat into the future so it is not operative like you can find in the last slides from young to representation.
What exactly we are.
Doing now, what kind of organizations were contacting the next?
Actually, the next products with deliver now interpret this in terms of what will happen in from the demand an from the supply side of these solutions.
That means these are broad steps.
This is not what we do tomorrow, but not suspected to happen, let's say till 2020 so.
Today we have learned that the vision in the transport White Paper is still to 2050, so this can be considered next steps.
These are based.
Not, of course, on my thing.
I have the owner the pleasure to coordinates two large projects with over 40 partners.
So this comes from our industry constituency and our sale research Development Towers 2020.

Greenness will be so much important, so there is a fate even in the Commission papers that there will be the need for new green logistics services that we have been business of green Logistics, but that has to be balanced by different factors.
1st May I don't know whether our good news or bad news trucks are not going away away.
It is expected to rise the price of oil up to even $300 a barrel, but the tracks will not go away, at least in most of freight operations.
Let's say across cities and terminals and ports.
It is expected that to the electric freight vehicles will be operating and will be significant only in cities.
Then of course our customers, big Unilever PNG's companies they are getting very much environmental friendly, environmental sensitive.
They ask the providers to deliver green services but is that true?
Is that the start of a new business?
There are conflicting views there.

We had an interesting discussion yesterday an hour but this is for life meeting so there was a large operator stating that no, that's just business as usual so just improving the environmental efficiency of regular.
Logistic operates on the other.
Brain did a new term called True Greenness.

I go to my customers and I propose them agreeing with this solution, which is probably most more costly, is probably slower, is probably less efficient in terms of logistics, let's say speed, but it's also very much more friendly in terms of environment, and that's a new business anyway regardless, which is a new business or improving or existing business.
There will be this challenge for the operators.
And the leaders will be the ones who are able to combine speed, flexibility and greenness.
So it's suspected that the customers will not renounce to speed, and they will be asking for much more flexibility in terms of roots and in terms of delivery modes and partnership.
We have heard a lot from from BLG.
This morning second factor cooperation.
Logistic resources will have to be managed cooperatively.
Why?
Because there are not so many resources investing in a new Fred Kardos.
For example, to build a new supply chain for a large.
I don't know automotive industry or to renovate fleet of trucks for a city delivery.
That costs a lot of money and that's I mean carefully and really.
Specially in this time of crisis.
In crisis, so there will be going to be cooperation even at a strategic level, but also at an operational level.
There must be cooperation in handling their reduced resources that are not just physical.
I mean just not just attracts or or terminals are the infrastructures they are scarce.
We have learned today that we will not be so many investments in that area and they have to be used much more efficiently with much more cooperation.
That's where cooperation, really.
Place is an important stores think about city logistics.
That's all about using scant resources in terms of space and and room for for unloading and so on.
So document that's we have heard from Stephen Miles from the MIT.
So I'm really strongly convinced now that this is going to be important.
I city will lead fighting complexity, and we also empower the users, not the systems.
The users as different thing.

1st through the new developer in the internal things, we expect that two things from the logistics side, that with this will allow real time monitoring and management, which nowadays we know from the teddy bear stories that is not so much real time.
2nd and this is quite challenging and quite provocative, but to include some kind of self regulation into the systems.
It is not everything in the hand of some user, either remote user or on field users, but something will go by its own way.
Thanks to intelligent rules embedded somewhere in some devices in the cargo in the vehicle or whatever.
Why?
Because these networks are getting so much complex, so so much distributed encompass that you cannot handle all the events.
With the human brain, no matter how many nice screens you produce on your web based systems, or no matter how nice they they pony is in the hand of the operator of the field operator.
You have to introduce some self regulation mechanism that for example prevents the wrong container of teddy bears to go on the wrong ship.
Do we need knowledge workers to do that?
Maybe not.
We need more intelligent logistics resources, so this is our hopes and.
Let's look at what should be delivered to fulfill his soul.
We will have, let's say, intelligent logistic resources.
That means intelligent cargo, yes, but also intelligent vehicle that maybe came before in the agenda of the Commission and intelligent infrastructure.
But apart from being telligent, that's very fuzzy turn and can can be smart or can be simply E enabled.
They have to be interoperable.
They have to be cheap because we want them everywhere and then they have to be in the end embedded.
I don't think that there is a future for separate tools who have no functions.
Rather than enabling some container or some package they should be embedded in already into there.
Second, there must be a common.
Not a framework, that's a result of the framework.
That's an implementation of the frame which you want, but a common platform.

Common platform means that I can access this public city to identify these logistic resources, packages, containers or whatever to call services attached to them by their owners, and that's another important thing and also to do something a bit more intelligently.
I found that in even in the MIT presentation to detect the events and to contextualize events because it's really stupid that I put.
At private, very complex information system just to detect that my container has arrived at the Port of Trieste.
A sorry that's not sensitive information.
That's not huge knowledge.
Working that does not require complex semantic web is really an simple event that could be detected.
So this could over via platform that can be a Federation of platform whatever you want.
But platform resembling what we have already in telephone systems in the in the computer networks and similar.

Then of course, on top of that, you must do much, many more intelligent things, so we have on top of this platform value at the service patterns that are dedicated to specific kind of use, like intermodal management, like city logistics for specific logistic.
I made this example of lives born because we have no Portuguese partners in trees in my project, so that's simply a fake example.
A city decides to build a service platform that works the city logistics involving audio operators but.
To do that, we have to have the two pieces before to be sure that it works.
That it's not just a pilot that is not just for the nice ones who have invested in the resources themselves.

If you want to involve at the other 96, if the four percent is in the share of market of the leader, the other 96 is made by the Portuguese truck drivers that probably don't do not have any means to join the platform unless.
It comes, let's say, for granted it is even invisible, would say.

So there you have very interesting areas to develop new services, and it's important that if you aim at a community service, like for example a city logistics or only on intermodal chain community services you have, you are a provider and you should be able to ensure that is what is called network externalities.
I mean all of them their relevant users should be in there, otherwise it is useless.
So this is also very provocative.
Young red downturned arrow for me.

Specialized ICT vendors in this particular sector of intelligent resources will not survive that long because if it is necessary to ask somebody working for the for the Navy, for the US Navy to give me something to track my containers, then that's only for very few.
Limited special cases.
It will never take off as a general service, so probably if I need to I will not ask the market for intelligent device for tax for my boxes.
Why?
Because the boxes under containers will come already with identification means with even computing devices the vehicles will come already equipped with what we need to do.
Intelligent logistics.
That's of course that's far away in the future, but.
It's for me, it's inevitable if we want for this to be general and not just another nice pilot.
Then the platform.
Of course that will interest the telco, sing for such a way even the public buildings and so on, and for the value added services you see a lot of factors that could enter this market.
Of course, the logistics service providers that will become, also IT service providers, but even why not?
Infrastructure operators?
If I am airport terminal operator I could.
I could build my service pattern on top of that and of course the associations if you want to link E as a means.
For example the Chamber of Commerce could be.
Build the platform, but when if they try to do that now without the missing pieces is a very nice experiment.
We have seen a lot of them funded in the past, very nice platforms working on behalf of the Community of, for example, small truck drivers where they adopted.
Not, I am not news in that direction.
And for me becauses we are starting from the end.
Actually while there is a lot of work to be done that way, OK, that's that's close to what the purpose.
Is.
What do we need to get there?
We need device and addition devices are not standardized.
They are not interoperable.
There are private.
Attempted tags for for contains there are there is everything.
There are no clear means to connect seamlessly at different ranges.
I mean from the short range to the web.
There is still much to be done in terms of miniaturisation, in terms of reduction of the cost of power, power consumption from the devices and so printed.
Electronics should be a target if you want to target the the boxes, for example, then we need some public ID platform.
I said it could be a Federation, could be everything, but it must be there.
This should be allowed trust and access to services.
Means I attach services to my height and to my whatever vehicle, and I'm sure that only authorized users access services.
And we should have cooperative infrastructure and cities that are already targeted by many research projects.
Then of course we need also to process an eye level.
Joseph level, we need common semantics.
Common definition of processes and we need the new business models that will sustain those value added services.
I don't say that this is a sequential process, but I say that all three areas must be targeted because not a single one of them will achieve the successor that we want.
So we must work in all this area simultaneously.
And that's all for my for my side, thanks.
